name: Absorb Appearance
description:
Absorb the appearance of another creature or object and store it in your character's memory, allowing it to be used with any utility effect that requires knowing something else's apperance. 
When absorbing the appearance of an unwilling creature, make an attack roll.
Works well with Utility: Disguise.

name: Absorb Element: Damage Type
description:
Draw power from an elemental source in the world and set the damage type of all abilities with the "Alternate Damage Type: Absorbed" modifier to that damage type.
This damage type remains until overwritten unless a limited duration modifier is applied to this effect.
For example, fire damage from a campfire or ice damage from snow.
In combat, this is a 1 AP action.
tags: Absorb, Damage Type, Buff, Combat, Self

name: Absorb Element: Heal
description:
Draw power from an elemental source in the world and restore HP depending on the power and quantity of that source. Determine the applicable sources appropriate when this ability is first purchased. 
For example, a pyromancer may draw 5 HP from a campfire, or any number of HP from a lava flow within an active volcano.
In combat, this is a 1 AP action.

name: Absorb Element: Recharge
description:
Draw power from an elemental source in the world and restore class resources depending on the power and quantity of that source. Determine the applicable sources appropriate when this ability is first purchased. 
For example, a pyromancer may draw 1 point from a campfire, or any number of points from a lava flow within an active volcano.
In combat, this is a 1 AP action.

name: Absorb: Knowledge
description:
Requires Absorb: Mimic Ability - Corpses or Utility: Telepathy.
Make an opposed INT check against the creature's INT CHAR while consuming its corpse or connected to its mind, if successful, absorb some of its memories chosen by the GM.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability
description:
When your character is afflicted by an enemy ability, consumes a signficant part of that creature, or otherwise absorbs from it in some meaningful way, you may make an opposed check based on the characteristic of the enemy's ability as a 0 AP reaction. If successful,  gain use of that enemy's ability for one round. This ability still must be activated using its normal activation conditions.
You still take the normal damage or other effects from any abilties you attempt to mimic.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability - Corpses
description:
Requires Absorb: Mimic Ability. Allows you to absorb an ability using the corpse of a creature instead of being afflicted by their ability. Make an opposed check against the stat as though the creature was still alive.
Allows obtaining buff and heal abilities the creature would not normally use against an opponent. By default, one use of one ability may be gained per corpse.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability - Corpses Only
description:
Requires Absorb: Mimic Ability - Corpses.
Removes the ability to use mimic ability when struck by abilities. You may now only mimic the abilities of corpses.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability Greater
description: Requires Absorb: Mimic Ability. When you absorb an enemy ability, you may now use that ability with the same conditions as the original creature until you take a long rest.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability Perfected
description: Requires Absorb: Mimic Ability Greater. When you absorb an enemy ability then take a long rest you may ask the GM for the XP value of the absorbed ability and pay 80% of that cost to permanently obtain that ability.

name: Action Point Bank
description: May spend AP towards using ability even if you don't have enough to trigger it this round. The ability activates once it recieves enough AP to activate.
xpCost: reduce reduction of AP cost by 10% (8 AP cost becomes a -65% modifier etc)

name: Action Point Cost
description:
How many AP must be spent to use this Ability

Only applicable to non Passive effects
xpCost:
8 : -70% xp
7 : -60% xp
6 : -50% xp
5 : -30% xp
4 : -20% xp
3 : 0 xp
2 : +50% xp
1 : +200% xp
0 : +100% xp for instant abilities
0 : +300% xp for duration abilities

name: Action Point Gain
description: Target immediately gains action points. Each target can only gain action points through this effect once per turn.

name: Action Point Loss
description: Target immediately loses action points.  Each target can only lose action points through this effect once per turn.

name: Additional Resource Pool
description: Create a secondary Class Resource for a class that can be drawn from separately from your first, max value is set to 1 by default.

name: Alter State
description:
When using this ability, alter the state of the attached creature or object to a new defined state (such as changing combat stance, shapeshifting, or transforming a weapon). 
Any ability that requires this state may use XP up to the amount spent on this effect without additional cost (if 300 xp is spent to transform into bear form, any abilities that require bear form up to 300 xp have no cost).
Discounts applied to this ability do not reduce the XP available to the abilities that require the altered state. Continung the above example, if the 300 xp were discounted to 50 xp by flaws, 300 xp is still available for purchasing abilities that require this state.  
By default, changing the state lasts until the end of the encounter and costs 3 AP to alter state.

name: Alter State: Sustained
description: You may only remain in the altered state so long as you keep spending AP / CR. When you do not spend the required AP/CR you return to your default state that doesn't possess this flaw.
xpCost:
-20% xp per resource cost
-10% xp per AP
-20% xp if concentration

name:
Alternate Activation Conditions
(Condition Arrays)
description:
This ability may be activated in multiple ways, but only require one at time of activation.
If any of the condition sets in this array is satisified the ability may be activated.
The amount of xp refunded to the ability is equal to the condition set with the smallest xp refund in the array.
For example an ability may be activated by spending successes or by spending class resources.
xpCost: 10 xp per alternate ability contained in the array

name: Alternate Effect (Ability Arrays)
description:
This is an organizational object to hold abilities, rather than an ability itself. 
Create several abilities with a common theme and place each within this array. The xp cost of this array is equal to the most expensive ability within the array plus 20 xp per item in the array.
To change which ability in this array is active you must use a 0 AP action "Change Ability" which your character obtains for having any ability array.
The abilities must be thematically very similar, and if any modifiers are still in play, you can't use any other effect from this array without ending them. This includes things like 0 AP abilities being limited to 1/turn, duration effects, cooldowns, and a partially filled AP Bank
xpCost: 20 xp per alternate ability contained in the array

name: Apply Negative Status
description:
Using the ability applies a negative status effect to the user.
If any duration is attached, the status lasts until the end of the duration.
If no duration is attached, the effect remains until the END of the creature's next turn.
xpCost: Applies a discount equal to the XP cost of the status as seen in the Status Effects Table

name: Apply Status
description: Apply a Status Effect to your target

name: Area of Effect: Growing
description: At the beginning of each round your AoE persists, it grows in radius by the amount specified by this extra.
xpCost: 3x the normal cost of the Range: Area Effect of choice

name: Area of Effect: Moving
description: Each round you may move the area of effect as a 0 ap action, except on the turn that the AoE was created.

name: Area of Effect: Shrinking
description:
Requires an AoE with duration.
At the beginning of each round your AoE persists, it shrinks in radius by the amount specified by this flaw to a minimum size of 1 square.
xpCost: 0.5x the normal cost of the Range: Area Effect extras attached to this ability

name: Area of Effect: Sticky
description: When applied to an ability with an area of effect and duration, the area may be targeted upon a creature or object instead of a point in the terrain. If that target moves, the area will remain around it.

name: Armor: Quick Change
description: When equipping or unequipping armor or shields, you may spend 1 less AP than the item normally requires.

name: Attack Opportunities
description:
Allows your character to automatically trigger a potential attack of opportunity reaction against any creature that leaves your melee attack range.
These attacks must be made with a weapon but do not cost AP.

name: Attunement Slots: Increase
description: Increases the character’s available attunement slots by 1
xpCost: 50 xp per slot, increasing by 50 xp for each purchase

name: Attunement Slots: Required
description:
Requires Object.
This Item requires using attunement slots to be equipped

name: Backfire Damage
description: Causes damage to yourself when used, not valid when damage resist entirely negates it or the ability heals yourself in any way. This Flaw no longer refunds XP if the average damage dealt by the Backfire would reduce the creature beyond 0 HP.
xpCost: Discount equal to the XP cost of the equivalent level of damage

name: Bestow Ability
description: Attach this effect to an existing seperate ability. When you activate this abilty you choose a creature within range and bestow them use of the attached ability while this ability lasts.

name: Body: Extra Limb
description: Character has a fully functional extra limb, can be arm, leg, prehensile tail. Anything the limb can normally do the extra limb can do as well.

name: Body: Limb Unusable
description:
When this ability is triggered, a chosen limb or other body part is rendered unusable for its duration. When the duration expires, the limb returns to normal use.
In most instances, this effect would render the chosen limb numb and limp.
xpCost:
-30 xp for minor body parts
-50 xp for limbs and major body parts

name: Breakthrough: Add
description: Increase the Character's Breakthrough stat.
xpCost: 60 xp per point, increasing by 60 xp for each purchase

name: Breakthrough: Limit Break - Postpone Death
description: When you would be incapacitated or killed, you may spend a breakthrough point to delay this outcome for 1 round.

name: Breakthrough: Limit Break - Ravenous Hatred
description: At the beginning of your turn, you may spend 3 breakthrough points to unleash your destructive impulses causing all your successful attacks to deal critical damage. For the next two rounds after that your attacks deal only half damage.

name: Breakthrough: Limit Break - Unflawed
description: When using breakthrough points to remove a flaw from a single use of an ability, the character may elect to spend an additional breakthrough point to remove ALL flaws from that ability for that ability use instead.
tags: Breakthrough, Buff, Self, Status, GM Approval

name: Breakthrough: Limit Break - Unlimited Speed
description: At the beginning of your turn, you may spend 3 breakthrough points to break your limits on actions. You may freely spend AP to go as far into the negative as you are willing for this turn, but are subject to all rules regarding negative AP. This effect may only be triggered once per encounter.

name: Breakthrough: Smash your Fate
description: You may use breakthrough points to cancel the negative effects of a Critical Failure, or to downgrade a Catastrophic Failure into a Critical Failure.

name: Breakthrough: Unbreakable
description: Your breakthrough points may now restore on short rests.
xpCost: 50 xp per breakthrough restored on short rest

name: Breakthrough: Unchained
description: Your breakthrough points now restore on long rest instead of per session.

name: Buff Ability
description:
An Ability to enhance yourself or allies. This is a general-use base for any buff effects not specified elsewhere.
The cost of the buff effect is proportional to the power of the effect.
xpCost:
Base cost 10-100 XP
10 xp - weak and simple effects (the light cantrip)
30 xp - moderately useful effects (Don't need to breathe)
50 xp - standard strength effects (see invisibility)
100 xp - very strong effects (become immune to a damage type)

name: Buff: Remove Flaw
description:
Choose a specific flaw when this effect is first purchased. Whenever this buff is applied, it removes the requirement on the target that the flaw be satisfied. 
This buff effect cannot have a duration of Encounter or any other longer duration.

name: Buff: Requires Check
description:
Removes the default success assumption when casting a buff or other positive effect on a friendly target. Instead, the character must make an appropriate DC3 skill check and the effect only triggers if the check succeeds.
This flaw allows for gaining bonus successes on the check to spend.

name: Buff: Stack the Unstackable
description:
Requires a buff effect that has a scaling cost and either a fixed duration (rounds or charges) or a Duration: Conditional
This buff can stack with itself. If the duration is conditional, all effects end at the same time.
xpCost:
Flat xp equal to the effects you want to stack
+100%

name: Bulky
description: This creature or object is large and bulky. Creatures of the same size or smaller may use it as cover or hide behind it for stealth rolls.

name: Channeled
description: You must spend CR each round to maintain this duration effect.

name: CHAR -1 Flaw
description: Remove points from a characteristic as part of a debuff effect. Cost assumes base characteristic is 3, and you cannot go negative (ie you can take this buff up to 3 times per char for 150, 100, and 50 xp each time)
xpCost: 50 xp * (the number you lower the CHAR to + 1)

name: CHAR +1
description: Add an additional point to a characteristic. You must purchase each rank in sequence (ex: you cannot buy 2 in STR if you have 0 in STR)
xpCost: 50 xp * the number you are raising the CHAR to, awarding a 20% discount to primary characteristics

name: CHAR +1 Buff
description: Add points to a characteristic. Cost assumes base characteristic is 3, and you must purchase increases in order.
xpCost: 50 xp * the number you are raising the CHAR to

name: Class Resource Cost
description: Ability costs class resources to use
xpCost: -50 xp cost per resource point consumed

name: Class Resource: Buff Pool
description:
Temporarily raise the maximum amount of resource you may store, does not grant any points of class resource in itself.
The duration may not be upgraded to passive or continuous.

name: Class Resource: Burn
description: Remove points from an enemy's resource pool after a successful attack

name: Class Resource: Burn Pool
description: After a successful attack, reduce the maximum number of points in an enemy's resource pool, burning any points that no longer fit

name: Class Resource: Combat Pool
description:
The attached class resource pool cannot benefit from any effects that restore class resources, and any class resources that would be restored to it are wasted.
However, the class resource pool instantly refills to full at the end of each combat encounter/scene instead of on short/long rests.
tags: Class Resource, Modifier, Self, Limited Use, Flaw

name: Class Resource: Daily Pool
description:
The attached class resource pool cannot benefit from any effects that restore class resources, and any class resources that would be restored to it are wasted.
Class resource points in this pool may ONLY be restored by taking a long rest.
tags: Class Resource, Modifier, Flaw, Self, Limited Use

name: Class Resource: Draining Pool
description:
The attached class resource pool defaults to empty instead of full. Whenever you take a rest of any significant length you lose all class resources. 
Increases the discount earned for each point of class resource attached to an ability.
xpCost:
Increases the discount per point of resource consumed from -50 to -100
Additionally doubles the size of your resource pool
tags: Class Resource, Flaw, Debuff, Self, Limit

name: Class Resource: Gain
description: Gain points of a class resource for using this ability

name: Class Resource: Increase
description: Increase a class resource pool's maximum size

name: Class Resource: Leaking Pool
description: The attached class resource pool does not replenish when taking a Rest. Whenever you take a rest of any significant length you instead lose some amount of class resources.
xpCost: -50 xp per CR lost when resting
tags: Class Resource, Flaw, Debuff, Self, Limit

name: Class Resource: Overcharge
description: When restoring resource points, if the amount of resource points restored is more than your maximum resource amount, the extra resource points above your max are converted to temporary resource points instead of being wasted. This effect may only trigger when at or below maximum resource points.

name: Class Resource: Special Resources
description:
Requires Class Resource: Stagnant Pool or Leaking Pool.
The attached class resource pool cannot have class resources restored to it that don't fit the aesthetic of the class and pool type. The class resource must also be specific, aka not just 'mana' or 'focus'.
Your character may only replenish this pool by completing certain approperiate roleplay actions, and not via abilities with restore Class Resource effects.
For example, a necromancer using 'Bones' as their class resource pool may not restore class resources by drinking a mana potion, instead they must actually collect bones from corpses.
tags: Class Resource, Modifier, Flaw, Self, Limit, GM Approval

name: Class Resource: Stagnant Pool
description: The attached class resource pool does not recover when the character rests or over time. The resource pool only increases when actions are completed that recover resource points
xpCost: Increases the discount per point of resource consumed from -50 to -100
tags: Class Resource, Flaw, Debuff, Self, Limit

name: Class Resource: Successful Recharge
description: Whenever your character makes a successful combat check of any kind during a combat encounter, they may spend 1 success to restore 1 Class Resource.

name: Cleanse: All (Meta)
description: Cleanse all negative status effects from a target. Does not require a logical means of status removal. (Requires a Meta power)

name: Cleanse: All (Physical)
description: Cleanse all negative status effects from a target. Must describe how your ability does so. (Requires a Physical power)

name: Cleanse: Immune (non-ranked)
description: Become immune to a specified status effect chosen when this ability is purchased
xpCost: 3 times the xp value of the chosen status effect

name: Cleanse: Immune (ranked)
description:
Reduce the ranks when inflicted with a specific ranked status. 
Example: Cleanse: Immune (Bleed 2) would reduce any bleed effects by 2 ranks, and negate them if they were 2 ranks or less
xpCost: Reducing X ranks costs the same as buying X ranks of the status + a flat 30xp

name: Cleanse: Immune (ranked) - Fully Immune
description: Become immune to obtaining any ranks of a chosen ranked status effect.
xpCost: 5x the xp cost of 1 rank of the status + 50 xp

name: Cleanse: Single
description: Cleanse a single status effect from a target

name: Cleanse: Status Protection
description:
Requires a Cleanse effect. 
When removing a status effect, apply a buff providing immunity to just that status effect for the duration of this effect.

name: Cleanse: Targeted
description: Remove a single instance of a specified status effect from the target, the specified effect is chosen when this ability is purchased. Other status effects may not be cleansed. Spending enough to remove 5 ranks removes all ranks of a ranked status.

name: Cleanse: Uncleansable (Duration)
description: Requires a duration. A status effect with this effect attached cannot be removed by other abilities, only the expiration of the duration may remove it.

name: Cleanse: Uncleansable (Permanent)
description: A status effect with this effect attached cannot be removed by other abilities, only the death of the caster may remove it.

name: Cleanse: Uncleansable (Ultimate Spite)
description: A status effect with this effect attached cannot be removed by other abilities, even with the death of the caster.

name: Cleaving Kills
description:
Requires Critical: Overkill
Overkill effect now applies to non-critical hits

name: Concentration
description:
When taking damage, must pass a RES save of DC 1+dice in damage pool or ability is cancelled.
When maintaining this ability for extended durations, the GM may ask you to make RES saves to keep it going (generally a DC3 save every 30 minutes)

name: Conditional Effect
description:
This effect can only be activated when the applied condition is true.
The condition awards more refunded XP the stricter the conditions.
xpCost:
-10 relatively simple (behind enemy, while holding a staff)
-30 some cost associated (restricts targets, narrows use)
-50 difficult to use at will (has specific requirements for use, severely narrows focus)

name: Conditional: Spell Components
description:
Components like in Dungeons and Dragons.
Verbal requires a specific phrase per ability (does not have to be loud or related to the effects)
Somatic requires you to make a specific motion (so you can't do it if you are restrained, but it doesn't necessarily require a free hand)
xpCost:
Verbal: -10xp
Somatic: -10xp
Focus: See Requires Item
Material: See Requires Consumable

name: Conscious
description: Ability ends when you lose consciousness

name: Cooldown
description:
Ability cannot be used again for a number of rounds, even if you have enough resources and action points.
Cannot have more than 5 rounds of cooldown.
xpCost: -10% xp per round of CD up to 5 rounds

name: Cooldown: Once Per Round
description:
Can't be selected for a 0 AP ability that doesn't have Reaction.
This ability can only be used a single time each round, regardless of if you have enough AP to use it multiple times.

name: Cooldown: Reduced
description: When this ability is activated it reduces one active cooldown on the target creature by the amount purchased. If that target creature has no active cooldowns, this effect does nothing.
xpCost: 80 xp per round of CD reduced

name: Crafting: Efficient Craftsman
description: Whenever your character crafts an item, they increase the amount of gold put down towards the item's completion per success in their check, allowing the item to be crafted in fewer checks overall.
xpCost: 10 xp per additional 1 gold obtained per success on crafting checks

name: Crafting: Instant Crafting - Consumable
description: When this ability activates, instantly create a consumable object up to this effect's gold value that your character knows to make and consume that amount of gold.

name: Crafting: Instant Crafting - Equipment
description: When this ability activates, instantly create a non-consumable object up to this effect's gold value that your character knows to make and consume that amount of gold.

name: Crafting: Junksmith
description:
You may use any material even relatively close to the needed material type instead of gold when crafting. Each 'Unit' of junk you collect is considered worth 20 gold that may only be used towards crafting.
Any items crafted using this effect permanently gain the [Critical Flaw] flaw without its associated discounts, destroying itself when the flaw is triggered. The [Critical Flaw] may be removed by spending the appropriate amount of gold to refit the item with proper parts.

name: Crafting: Materials Gathering
description: Your character may passively gather crafting materials over time to reduce the cost of building items. You may gather 5 gold worth of materials per in-game day provided you had at least some time to do so. These resources may only be used to craft items.
xpCost:
75 xp per 5 gold of proper materials per day
15 xp per 5 gold of Junk materials per day (see Wealth: Junksmith)

name: Crafting: Materials Pouch
description: Your character may passively gather crafting materials each day. The amount purchased is the most value you can hold at one time (i.e it doesn't build further during downtime).
xpCost:
10 xp per 10 gold, increasing by 10 xp per purchase
2 xp per 10 gold of Junk, increasing by 2xp per purchase (see Wealth: Junksmith)

name: Crafting: Quick Craftsman
description: Reduce the time required to make a crafting check.
xpCost: 50 xp per 10% time decrease. Minimum 10% time

name: Critical Flaw
description: Whenever this ability rolls no natural successes and the fate die rolls a 1, this ability triggers a Catastrophic Failure appropriate to the nature of the ability and situation at hand.

name: Critical: Bloodlust
description: Whenever this ability gains enough successes to be able to critically hit, it must do so rather than apply other effects.

name: Critical: Deadly
description: Critical Hits made by this ability deal maximized damage

name: Critical: Honed
description: You require one less success to invoke a critical hit with this ability

name: Critical: Killing Power
description: Whenever you deal a critical hit with this ability, you may now choose to add flat damage modifiers (such as those from characteristics) to your damage result BEFORE multiplication instead of after.
xpCost: 100 xp and +100% increase (so just this effect is 200xp)

name: Critical: Lucky Shot
description: Whenever your fate die rolls a 6 or greater for this ability, if the roll was a success then it becomes upgraded to a critical success

name: Critical: Overkill
description:
When you kill a creature using a critical hit that deals more damage than it had remaining HP, if there is another creature behind the original target, you may redirect the remaining damage to that second target.
If the second target was harder to hit, you must spend the difference in successes.

name: Critical: Ravenous
description: Bestow a buff effect that while in effect causes all hits made by the target character to upgrade into critical hits.

name: Critical: Reaper
description:
Requires Critical: Overkill. Whenever you trigger Overkill you may target any creature adjacent to the killed target, not just behind them. Additionally, you may continue to carry damage to adjacent targets until the full damage of the attack has been dealt, so long as each target is killed before moving on to the next.
If your critical attack is melee, you may freely make 1 square steps to reach new targets so long as this effect is active.
This effect is extremely potent versus numerous Grunt-type enemies.

name: Critical: Savage
description: Add extra damage dice when this attack gets a Critical Hit
xpCost: 50% of the normal cost of the damage dice

name: Critical: Terrorizing
description: When you kill a creature using a critical hit that deals far more damage than it had remaining HP (>20), all remaining enemies within visible and auditory range of the kill must make a DC3 RES check or become Feared for 2 rounds

name: Cursed Power
description:
When using this ability, the end results of the ability's use is always considered to be one threat level higher than whatever was normally determined.
Generally, this means something bad will always happen when this ability is used, or when something bad happens this effect makes it worse.
When selecting this flaw, you may opt to discuss with your GM for a standardized effect to occur, such as loss of control of your character, an ally is struck by lighting, or some other appropriate thematics for the ability, though depending on the nature of this the GM may reduce or increase the discount amount of this flaw.
For some examples, a critical success goes too far and also causes a negative effect, a success is considered a success with threat, or a success with threat is considered a success and a critical failure together.

name: Damage +1
description: Increases how much damage this attack deals by 1 of a specified damage type
xpCost:
20 xp per point
this cost increases by 10 xp each time it is purchased

name: Damage Ability / Heal Ability
description:
A combat ability whose effect is to deal or heal damage.
All die must be of the same damage type selected when this effect is first purchased.
To add damage of a second damage type purchase the Damage: Additional Type for each additional damage type.
xpCost:
70 xp for 1d6 damage
this cost increases by 35 xp each time it is purchased
Formula: 70*x+35*(x-1)*x/2

name: Damage Resist: Reduce Category
description:
Lowers all types of damage resistance by 1 in the chosen category as a debuff.
If a creature's damage resistance is lowered below 0, any damage they take of that type is increased by the negative amount.
Becomes a flaw instead when applied to yourself or an ally

name: Damage Resist: Reduce Type
description:
Lowers a single type of damage resistance by 1 as a debuff.
If a creature's damage resistance is lowered below 0, any damage they take of that type is increased by the negative amount.
Becomes a flaw instead when applied to yourself or an ally

name: Damage Type +1 (Global)
description: Increase how much damage you deal of a specified type for all instances of that damage type by 1

name: Damage: Absorb Type
description: This ability is able to deal the damage type of the last type of damage that struck the character

name: Damage: Add CHAR
description:
Adds the number of dice in a CHAR’s pool to the damage the attack deals.
This can only be purchased once per ability.

name: Damage: Additional Type
description: Allows damage dice of an additional damage type to be added to this ability. All damage types added this way are considered part of the same attack and successes may be spent in any of their tables. The target's highest damage resistance is used (e.g slashing+fire damage dealt to a target with 5 slashing DR and 3 fire DR is reduced by 5). True damage may not be an additional type, use Damage: Alternate Type instead

name: Damage: Alternate Type
description:
The Ability gains an alternative damage type that can be swapped between, one damage type per purchase.
Damage type is chosen when ability is used.
Differs from altered state in that all effects remain active, only damage type changes.

name: Damage: Alternate Type: Absorbed
description: This ability changes its damage type to match the most recently absorbed damage type from the Absorb Element effect.

name: Damage: Alternate Type: AP Cost
description:
Requires Damage: Alternate Type. Changing damage type also inflicts an AP cost.
If this ability also has the Reloading flaw, the damage type may be changed as part of that effect.
xpCost:
-30 xp 1 AP
-50 xp 2 AP
-80 xp 3 AP

name: Damage: Charge Through
description:
Requires Damage: Charging Attack.
When you would make a Charging Attack, you no longer must give up all your remaining movement.

name: Damage: Charging Attack
description:
Requires melee attack.
When you hit a target with this attack and have movement remaining and have traveled at least half your base movement distance, you may give up all remaining movement to deal half that movement as bonus flat damage.

name: Damage: Convert Damage Type
description: Applies a buff that converts all damage done by the character to the damage type chosen when this extra is purchased. Can only be used on allies.

name: Damage: Damage Split
description: The damage of this attack becomes split evenly between all creatures adjacent to the primary target and the primary target. If there are no targets adjacent to the primary target, it receives the full normal damage.

name: Damage: Killing Blows
description:
Whenever this ability deals damage, roll your damage dice twice and take the higher result and ignore the lower result.
Attacks made with this ability cannot make use of Holding Back rules and cannot deal Nonlethal damage.

name: Damage: Link to Environment
description:
The damage of this ability is modified by environmental factors.
Examples include throw a boulder where damage depends on the size of boulders around, or deal additional fire damage depending on ambient heat.

name: Damage: Link to Weapon
description:
You cannot have this extra and any additional Damage effect on the same ability.
The damage of this ability will change to match the damage of an equipped weapon, but does not get any additional effects (improved critical etc)
This extra also applies to any healing dice a weapon applies to targets. If a weapon has both healing dice and damage dice, you must select which this extra applies to. You may take this twice to transfer both healing and damage.

name: Damage: Link to Weapon Effects
description: When this ability strikes, it also activates any abilities attached to the currently equipped weapon

name: Damage: Moderate
description: Apply to a damage die to cause it to always give its average value instead of being rolled.

name: Damage: Object Destruction
description: Deal 3x damage to objects. If the object has Incredible Durability and the damage type this ability deals is not the one the object is vulnerable to, you may still deal normal (1x) damage to it

name: Damage: Pierce / Penetration
description: When dealing damage of the type chosen when this extra is bought, ignore a number of points of the target's Damage Resistance to that damage type.
tags: Damage Type, Damage, Pierce, Defense, Penetration

name: Damage: Random Damage Type
description: Convert all damage done by this ability to a random damage type selected via roll each time the ability is used.

name: Damage: Thorns
description:
Whenever your character takes damage in melee you deal any attached damage dice to the attacking creature as a 0 AP reaction.
Taking this effect multiple times allows additional uses of the 0 AP reaction per turn.

name: Damage: Vampirism
description: Whenever this ability deals damage, it also heals you for an amount linked to the damage you dealt.
xpCost:
+50% xp Half-damage to healing
+100% xp Full damage to healing

name: DC: Easier
description:
The DC for any checks that use the Ability may be decreased by 1.
If the DC of the check is reduced to 0, the roll is cancelled and no bonus successes may be obtained without additional effects.
This effect may not reduce the DC of a check below 0.
If making an opposed check, add one free success to your roll.

name: DC: Harder
description:
The DC for any checks to use the Ability are increased by 1.
If making an opposed check, give the opponent an additional success.

name: Death: Dark Sign
description: When returning from death, restore 1 HP and 1 class resource per rank of this effect.

name: Death: Resurrection (Players)
description:
Restores a target dead creature to life, bringing them back to 1 HP but not restoring limbs/body parts that were removed.
Does not cure diseases or conditions that may lead to the target dying again the next round, those must be attached separately.
The target creature returns with all resource pools and limited-use abilities depleted.
Dead targets must be mostly physically intact and have a free and willing soul to return to life. 
This effect may only target Players and is not considered a resurrection ability in terms of the world and its setting, aka gameplay only.

name: Death: Resurrection (RP)
description:
Requires Death: Resurrection (Players)
Restores a target dead creature to life, bringing them back to 1 HP but not restoring limbs/body parts that were removed.
Does not cure diseases or conditions that may lead to the target dying again the next round, those must be attached separately.
The target creature returns with all resource pools and limited-use abilities depleted.
Dead targets must be mostly physically intact and have a free and willing soul to return to life. 
This effect may only target NPCs and is considered a roleplay ability, making the world react to your very likely shocking power over death itself.

name: Death: Revenant
description:
At the start of your turn and if you are dead, return from death all by your goddamned self. Return to 1 HP and 0 AP. You have any resource points that you had when you died.
You do not restore lost limbs and similar, but do regenerate enough so as to not be in any immediate danger of death (other than by other creature's actions).

name: Debuff Ability
description:
An ability that applies a status effect to a hostile, cost increases with greater debilitation.
When applying a status effect, use the XP values listed in the status effect table, otherwise use the guidelines on this effect to determine a price.
xpCost:
Base cost 10-100 XP
10 xp - weak and simple effects (enemy has glowing outline)
30 xp - moderately useful effects (slow movement)
50 xp - standard strength effects (reduce die in a check)
100 xp - very strong effects (apply vulnerable status)

name: Defense Ability
description:
An ability to mitigate damage taken. This is a general-use base for any defense effects not specified elsewhere.
The cost of the defense effect is proportional to the power of the effect.
xpCost:
Base cost 10-100 XP
10 xp - weak and simple effects 
30 xp - moderately useful effects
50 xp - standard strength effects
100 xp - very strong effects

name: Defense: Bodyguard
description: Choose a creature or object adjacent to your character, when that creature would take damage you may elect to move into their square and take that damage instead.

name: Defense: Critical Resistance
description: Whenever the creature is struck by a critical hit, reduce the multiplier value of that critical hit by 1, to a minimum of 1.

name: Defense: Damage Negate
description: Make a skill check and reduce incoming damage of the next attack by 1 for every success rolled in your skill check.

name: Defense: Damage Redirect
description: When you would take damage while this effect is active and you would either reduce that damage to 0 or evade that attack via AC or the Defend Action, you may make a skill check with a DC of the number of successes the enemy's attack made to "catch" the projectile, then make a free attack check against a target within the original ability's range, if it succeeds you redirect the original damage to the target.

name: Defense: Damage Redirect Alt
description:
Once per turn when you reduce damage taken to 0 or evade an attack via AC or the Defend Action, for 0ap you may make an attack roll against a target within range of the original ability to apply the damage of the original ability.
This effect has Reaction and Reaction Only baked into it.

name: Defense: Damage Redirect Alt 2
description:
Once per turn when you are targeted by a damaging effect you may make an opposed roll against the attack. If you roll more successes than your opponent you negate the attack, and may make a free attack against a target within range of the original ability to deal the original damage. You don't roll for that attack, instead you use any additional success from the opposed roll.
This effect has Reaction and Reaction Only baked into it.

name: Defense: Damage Resist- Absorb
description: When you take damage but completely negate that damage via damage resistance, you may heal for half the amount of the damage you would have taken if you had no damage resistance.

name: Defense: Damage Resist- Category
description:
Resists a group of damage types (Physical, Elemental, or Esoteric)
The price increases for all further purchases regardless of which type was purchased
xpCost:
15 xp per point, increasing by 7 xp after each purchase
Formula: 15*x+7*(x-1)*x/2

name: Defense: Damage Resist- Half Type
description: Applies a buff effect that reduces remaining damage taken by half after normal damage resistances, but only for the specified type.

name: Defense: Damage Resist- Type
description:
Resists a single damage type (such as slashing, fire, dark, etc)
The price increases for all further purchases regardless of which type was purchased
xpCost:
5 xp per point, increasing by 2 xp after each purchase
Formula: 5*x+2*(x-1)*x/2

name: Defense: Damage Type Half
description: Choose a damage type, and your character now takes half damage from that type after flat resistances are applied.

name: Defense: Damage Type Immunity
description: Choose a damage type, and your character is now immune to damage from this one specific damage type. Each character may only have one of this effect in place a time for XP, and one from equipment/items.

name: Defense: Damage Type Strength
description: Choose a damage type, and your character is now strong versus damage from this one specific damage type, meaning that you only take half of the damage you normally would after DR. Each character may only have one of this effect in place a time for XP, and one from equipment/items.

name: Defense: Evasive Maneuvers
description: Whenever this character is targeted by a ranged attack, if this character had moved at least 5 squares on its previous turn, increase the DC of the ranged attack by 1.

name: Defense: Hard to Hit
description:
Increases the DC of attack checks against you by 1 for each rank of this effect.
When making opposed defensive rolls, such as via the Defend Action, gain one bonus success instead.
xpCost:
160 xp, doubling for each purchase
EX: 3 Ranks costs (160+320+640)xp

name: Defense: It Cut Only Thread
description:
Requires wearing Equipment that has normal durability and possesses stats of some kind.
Once per round, you may choose to halve damage taken from one action by applying that damage with Sunder to a piece of equipment you current have equipped and that is not immune to damage.
In order to activate this effect, this substitution must make logical sense in the current cirumstances. If an object is destroyed in any part by this effect it cannot be repaired mid-combat by any means.

name: Defense: Type Restriction
description: The attached defensive effect may only trigger when the damage is of the type specified when this flaw is taken
xpCost:
-50 xp for a single damage type
-30 xp for single damage class (melee, ranged, magic, etc)

name: Defense: Use Mode Restriction
description: The attached defense effect may only trigger when the attack is not performed by the specified Use Modes (Ex: Charge Attack, Flurry Attack, Etc.)

name: Delayed Effect
description: Effect takes time before it actually activates
xpCost: -50 xp per round up to 5 rounds

name: Delayed Effect: Highlighted
description:
Requires Delayed Effect of at least 1 round. When used, the ability creates some clear warning indicating roughly when and where the the delayed effect will take place. 
For example, creating a highlighted circle on the ground for an AoE, or a timer indicating how many rounds until a creature will take massive damage.

name: Dice -1
description: Using the ability has one less die, can stack. Must be used on an ability that gains dice from some other Effect/Extra and may not go below the gained dice. Example: the ability gains 5 dice from the Character's FIT, the Dice -1 Extra may be added up to 5 times.
xpCost: -40 xp * the number of times this extra has been purchased (the second purchase is -80xp)
tags: Dice Roll, Flaw, Passive, Self, Successes

name: Dice +1
description: Using the ability has an extra die, can stack
xpCost: 40 xp * the number of times this extra has been purchased (the second purchase is 80xp)
tags: Dice Roll, Buff, Passive, Self, Successes

name: Disarming
description: When this ability targets an object via a called shot, if applicable that object is disarmed or otherwise knocked out of the owner's possession.

name: Dispel
description: Target an ongoing effect and make an opposed ability check against the caster. If you succeed, the effect is ended.

name: Distracting
description: If this ability causes a concentration check to be made as a result of its activation, the DC of that concentration check is higher.

name: Duration: Charges
description: Requires a Buff or Debuff Effect. After the end of the ability's duration, the effect is able to be used a certain number of additional times before deactivating. A charge is considered depleted whenever an action is performed that is affected by the buff/debuff. The effect is considered dispellable while any charges remain, and any remaining charges are lost at the end of an encounter.

name: Duration: Charges Only
description:
Requires Duration: Charges on a 1 round ability with no other duration increases.
Remove the initial 1 round duration
tags: Duration, Buff, Debuff, Limited Use, Flaw

name: Duration: Committed Resources
description:
Requires another Duration effect that causes the ability to last longer than 1 round and a class resource cost for activation.
When this ability is activated your maximum class resource pool is reduced by the class resource cost of this ability until this ability's duration ends. When the duration effect ends your max pool returns to normal.
This flaw is not selectable if you have no inherent means beyond resting to restore class resources.
If this ability has a channeled resource cost, they may also reduce your maximum pool when consumed to further refund additional xp. Ex: Each round your maximum CR reduces
xpCost:
-10% xp per CR for base flaw
-5% additional xp for channeled durations

name: Duration: Conditional
description:
Requires a Duration. 
The duration on this ability may only remain so long as the condition chosen when this flaw is purchased is true. If the condition becomes false at any time, the duration ends early and immediately. 
The false condition must be reasonably able to occur during normal circumstances of this ability's use for this flaw to be valid.
Ex: "If all nine planets are perfectly aligned" is not a valid condition to cancel your effects.
xpCost: -10% to -100% from the multiplier upcharges (can't reduce below 0).

name: Duration: Constantly Repeating Effect
description: Instant effects become effects that are constantly active and repeat themselves over and over beyond even reactions. This modifier needs GM approval (e.g. constant Dispel is fine, constant Damage Negate All is not, constant Damage doesn't even make sense)

name: Duration: Dispel Immune
description:
Ability cannot be dispelled. If Duration: Indefinite is applied with no Duration: Conditional modifiers, all activation modifiers must be removed.
Can potentially be abused, so please don't.

name: Duration: Encounter
description: Convert Instant and 1 round effects to last until the end of the current encounter / scene. Instant effects can be triggered once on each of your turns.

name: Duration: Extend
description: When this ability targets a creature under the affect of a duration effect, add additional rounds of duration to that existing effect. If there are no duration effects active on the target, this effect does nothing.

name: Duration: Indefinite
description: Ability lasts until dispelled or cancelled. AP Cost modifiers are reduced by half

name: Duration: Non-passive
description: Convert a passive duration to 1 round duration that can be dispelled. Duration can be extended with more rounds/maintained as normal for 1 round abilities

name: Duration: Overclocked
description:
Requires a duration.
Causes the attached duration effect to trigger at the start of every turn in the initiative order instead of on only one turn per round.

name: Duration: Rounds
description: Convert Instant and 1 round effects to a longer duration. Instant effects can be triggered once on each of your turns, and have a starting value of 0 rounds

name: Duration: Single Charge
description:
Requires 1 Round duration.
This ability no longer applies to every applicable action during the round, instead only applying to the first applicable action.

name: Duration: Skillful Start
description: When you make a skill check to begin a duration effect you may spend additional successes from that check to add additional rounds of duration that begin when the effect would normally end. Adds 1 round per additional success.

name: Duration: Stackable Concentration
description: Requires Concentation duration. You can recast this ability multiple times to stack its effects. When you fail the RES save, all effects end. If the ability has any other Duration: Maintained modifiers, they still behave as if only one instance is in effect.

name: Duration: Until Rest / 24hr
description:
Requires Duration: Indefinite.
The effect with this duration goes away when the character rests or 24hrs have passed which ever comes first.

name: Environmental Weakness
description:
Your character is actively averse to a certain environmental effect such as sunlight, silver, rain, flowers, etc.
If the weakness you possess is very rare, the GM may elect to reduce the values of this flaw.
If Aversion, your character simply hates it on a roleplay level and wishes to avoid it.
If Allergic, your character gains Sickened(1) when in contact. 
If Harmful, your character gains Exhausted when in contact and takes 1 True Damage each round.
If Deadly, your character gains all the above and takes 20 True Damage each round.
xpCost:
Aversion: -30 xp
Allergic: -50 xp
Harmful: -80 xp
Deadly: -200 xp

name: Environmental Weakness: Disable Ability
description: Whenever your character is exposed to an environmental weakness, this ability is disabled completely for a number of rounds.

name: Equipment: Banish
description: While this ability is active, the targets equipment is banished. The target cannot use active abilities from equipment, but benefits from any ongoing effects.

name: Equipment: Disable
description: While this ability is active, the target cannot benefit from passive or active abilities from their equipment.

name: Excludes Target Type
description:
If the ability is used against a target that is considered part of the classification chosen when this flaw is taken, this ability can only deal a max of 1 damage and any other effects fail.
The XP refund of this flaw depends on how wide the chosen classification is, with more wide choices refunding more XP.
Examples: cannot affect ghosts, cannot affect metal objects, cannot affect Eldritch creatures, cannot affect living creatures
xpCost: -10 xp to -100 xp at GM approval

name: Exclusive
description:
Requires at least one other ability with this modifier, not in an array with this ability, or this ability must be normally castable on multiple targets at once.
Only one ability with this modifier may be active at a time.

name: Exploration: Foraging
description: Your character is always assumed to be able to feed themselves in any hospitable wild environment. You must still make checks to provide enough food for multiple people or within sparse or otherwise inhospitable environments, but do so with 1 free success.

name: Exploration: Internal Compass
description: Your character always knows which direction is North and gains 1 free success on any checks related to navigation or mapping

name: Exploration: Treasure Sense
description: Double your character's CUN radius for detecting hidden treasure or noticing objects of substantial monetary value. Gain 1 free success on any checks to determine the approximate gold value of any item.

name: Extended Cast Time
description:
The Ability takes a number of minutes to complete, making it unfeasible to use in combat situations.
For every 30 minutes of continuous casting, you must make a concentration check or lose focus and fail the cast.
xpCost: -10 xp cost per minute of cast time

name: Fail Saves
description:
Requires a duration.
While this ability is active, you automatically fail saves for the specified CHAR

name: Failure Penalty
description:
Whenever this ability makes a check and fails, inflict a specified negative penalty on the creature who used the ability. This flaw is incompatible with abilities that award free successes.
If desired you may apply a negative status for the failure effect, refunding 50% of it's xp value.
xpCost:
-10 xp to -50 xp depending on severity of penalty
and/or
-50% of a status effect's xp cost

name: Fitness: Throwing Practice
description:
Whenever you throw an object, multiply the number of squares you may throw it by 2.
You may now throw grappled creatures half this distance instead of only 1 square.
Increase the multiplier for this effect by 1 for each purchase.

name: Focus
description: You must repeat the initial attack roll each turn for 0 ap. If you fail the ability ends. Can also be used with Buff: Requires Check for positive effects

name: Forced Movement: Momentum Transfer
description: Requires melee attack. When you hit a target with this attack and have movement remaining, you can give up remaining movement (max of your movespeed for that movement type) to push the target that many squares directly away from you.

name: Friendliest Fire
description:
Requires an ability that may target allies with negative effects.
Damage, negative statuses, and other harmful effects caused by this abilty no longer make attack rolls or trigger saves against allies, they instead instantly cause the negative effect to the affected allies.

name: Full Concentration
description:
Requires Duration: Conditional: Concentration.
While this concentration effect is maintained, you can take no other actions except to continue the effect or end the effect.

name: Full Power Only
description: The ability with this flaw attached may not make use the Hold Back rules to reduce the damage it deals or deal Nonlethal damage

name: Handedness
description:
How many hands are required to use this ability.
In short-hand, Handedness(1) refers to requiring 1 hand, and Handedness(2) requires 2.
xpCost:
No hands required 0xp
Takes up a hand -20xp
Takes up 2 hands -40xp
Requires more than 2 hands -80 xp

name: Heal: Overheal
description: When this ability heals a creature, if the amount of healing is greater than the amount of HP the creature is missing, the remainder of the healing becomes temporary HP instead of being wasted. This effect can only trigger when the target creature is below or at their maximum HP and does not have temporary HP.

name: Health: Increase
description: Increases a character's maximum HP.
xpCost:
5 xp per 1 HP
This increases in cost by 5 xp for each purchase.
Formula: 5(n*(n+1)/2)

name: Health: Temporary HP
description: Bestows the target creature with temporary HP, following all rules for temporary hit points.

name: Initiative: decrease
description: Whenever your character makes an initiative roll, decrease that value
xpCost:
-30 xp per decrease * the number of increases you've purchased
You may not decrease your initiative below your SPD.
For example, -2 Initiative refunds -90 xp (-30 + -60)

name: Initiative: Increase
description: Whenever your character makes an initiative roll, increase that value
xpCost:
30 xp * the number of increases you've purchased
For example, +2 Initiative costs 90 xp (30 + 60)

name: Initiative: Offensive Decrease
description: Reduce the initiative of a target creature

name: Initiative: Tag Team (Command)
description:
Target an ally within range of this ability. That ally may immediately take an action before returning to your turn (provided you have any AP remaining).
The ally may refuse to take an action at no cost to themselves.

name: Interrupt
description: Ability may be used at any point during combat with an additional AP cost of 3

name: Interruptable
description: An enemy within reach of the target can spend 3 AP to end this effect with no check

name: Limited Uses
description: The ability may only be used a certain number of times before becoming inert. If this ability is purchased with XP these uses refresh on long rest.
tags: Object, Equipment, Limit, Flaw, Limited Use

name: Limited Uses: Recharge Condition
description: Requires Limited Uses. This ability restores a single use to the object when a condition is met.
xpCost: reduces the discount on this ability by 20%
tags: Object, Equipment, GM Approval, Buff, Ammo

name: Limited Uses: Recharge Time
description: Requires Limited Uses. This ability restores a single use to the object when a certain amount of time has passed.
xpCost:
Reduces the discount on this ability:
1/week: 5%
1/day: 10%
1/hour: 25%

name: Link to Ability / Attack
description: Ability can only activate after a successful ability/attack roll, this ability activates automatically after the linked check completes and costs AP equal to whichever is greater between this ability and the linked ability.

name: Link to Attack: Extra Effort
description: Ability can only activate after a successful attack roll, AP cost of ability added to the AP cost of the attack roll to activate

name: Link to Attack: Half Damage
description: Requires Link to Attack, lowers default damage to half a normal attack
xpCost: flat discount of 50% of the cost of damage dice on the attack

name: Luck: Fate's Will
description: The ability can only activate when the fate dice rolls a 6.

name: Luck: Favored of Fate
description: Your Fate Die now considers a 5 to be a 6 on the roll.
tags: Luck, Dice Roll, Critical, Passive, Buff, Self

name: Luck: Flip of the Coin
description: The ability can only activate when succeeding a 50/50 coin flip

name: Luck: Foes
description: Your Luck rerolls obtained from your Luck characteristic may now also be used to re-roll the dice of your enemies so long as they are in sight of you

name: Luck: Fortunate
description: Your Luck ReRolls restore on long rests instead of per session

name: Luck: Friends
description: Your Luck rerolls obtained from your Luck characteristic may now also be used to re-roll the dice of your allies so long as they are in sight of you

name: Luck: Gambler of Fate
description: Requires Luck: Fortunate. You may regain Luck ReRolls on short rests
xpCost: 50 xp per reroll restored on short rest

name: Luck: Ill-Fated
description: Rolls of a 2 on your fate die also trigger any effects that would occur when it rolled a 1.

name: Luck: Intense Control
description: You may no longer critically fail any check you make, but you also may no longer critically succeed.

name: Luck: Lucky Bastard
description: You may add 1 point to the value of your fate die for determining advantage effects for every 3 points you have in your LCK characteristic

name: Luck: Multiple Fates
description: You may roll an additional Fate Die when you make any check. The additional Fate Die is subject to any effects that apply to your first Fate Die.

name: Luck: Nothing to Chance
description: Your fate die may no longer provide negative or positive effects.

name: Luck: Play the Odds
description:
Whenever you roll a dice pool, if two or more dice roll their max natural values you trigger a positive luck effect, increasing in intensity the more max dice there are in this roll.
Conversely, whenever multiple dice roll their minimum natural values you trigger a negative luck effect, similarly increasing the more minimum dice there are in this roll.
tags: Luck, Dice Roll, Flaw, Buff, Debuff

name: Luck: Play to Win
description: Whenever you achieve a critical success, you may spend 3 ReRolls to upgrade it into a Colossal Success with your GM's approval.

name: Luck: Threatened Odds
description: Whenever this ability gains threat from the Fate die rolling a natural 1, it removes successes from the roll result in addition to the normal threat effects.

name: Merchant Price
description:
If you pay someone to make an item for you, this is the standard amount extra they'd like to be paid.
Merchants follow player crafting rules when obtaining items that don't already exist in their inventory for time to craft / time to obtain.
If you need an item faster, consider adding Crafting: Quick Craftsman in combination with Single Use as a sub-effect.

name: Metaphysics Switch
description: When this ability is used, you may now choose (and announce for the GM to know) whether the ability is following physical or metaphysical rules instead of the ability being locked to one or the other at creation.

name: Minion: Absorb Ability Modifiers
description:
Requires an object to be consumed as part of the minion's summoning. 
The minion gains a creature template determined by the GM depending on what was consumed as part of it's summoning. 
For example, a necromancer raising a zombie using a dragon corpse, the zombie may gain a fire breath ability.

name: Minion: Absorb Attributes
description:
Requires an object to be consumed as part of the minion's summoning. 
The attributes of the minion, such as movement type, size, appearance, change depending on the material consumed as part of the minion's summoning.

name: Minion: Cannot Speak
description: Your minion understands your commands, but cannot reply in kind (like an animal companion). Your minion can only communicate in ways appropriate to its form.

name: Minion: Companion
description:
Incompatible with duration and activation modifiers.
Your minion is now a companion, meaning it exists as its own independent creature and remains until it dies, and must be resurrected using player rules instead of re-summoned.
Companions are generally obedient, but as their own entity, may choose to take independent action. Similarly, companion minions may also act beneficially without your instruction.

name: Minion: Controlled
description: Changes the attached minion into a controlled minion. Controlled minions cannot act independently of their owner, and consume their owner's AP to take any action.

name: Minion: Harvestable
description:
When your minion dies, it's body does not dissipate or otherwise become rendered unusable like normal. Instead, the minion's body remains as a deceased/destroyed tangible object.
The price of this extra is determined by how potentially valuable this effect may be, depending on the nature of the minion.

name: Minion: Lesser
description:
Summon a lesser minion creature, see Minion. Lesser Minions have 1 HP and 5 Characteristic points and are mostly for RP and specific minor utility purposes, such as a wizard's owl familiar or a necromancer's talking skull companion.
Pairs well with Minion: Companion.

name: Minion: Multi-Summon
description: When using AP to bring forth a minion, you may choose to bring forth an additional minion as part of the same action. This does not increase the total summon limit of a minion.

name: Minion: Rebellious
description: Your minions summoned with this flaw are not obligated inherently to follow your commands. In order to command your minion, you must persuade them via some way, shape, or means. Otherwise, your minion may easily choose to disobey, not act, or even act maliciously according to their nature.

name: Minion: Share Sense
description: Choose a sense your minion possesses, you immediately know anything the minion detects with that sense

name: Minion: Special Communication
description:
You possess a special method that allows you to communicate with your minions beyond normal verbal means, such as telepathy, special hand gestures, or similar. 
This defaults to only within visual range, but may be outside of visual range by adding the Range Extra.

name: Minion: Spell Focus
description: While your minion is within range of any abilities, you may elect to instead have the minion become the source of the ability

name: Minion: Summon
description:
Create a minion. By default only one copy of the minion can exist at a time. Re-activating this ability when at maximum minions replaces the oldest minion with a new one. When a minion hits 0 hp or its duration expires it disappears, or its body is otherwise rendered unusable.
Create a separate character sheet to keep track of your minion's stats. Its starting characteristics are determined by point buy with 14 points, but otherwise following player rules. See Minion rules.
You pay any xp costs for minion abilities/advancement at a one to one price, and the price of any minion abilities are not affected by any prices or multipliers on this Summon Ability.
Minions may not have this ability.

name: Minion: Summon Elite
description: Summon an Elite enemy template, selected when you make this ability. You cannot add anything to the template.

name: Minion: Summon Grunt
description: Summon a Grunt enemy template, selected when you make this ability. You cannot add anything to the template.

name: Minion: Summon Horde
description: Create a horde minion. Functions mostly the same as Minion: Summon, but the base minion has HP based only on RES, not RES and level, all members of the horde are summoned at once, and only one horde can exist at a time.
xpCost: 10 xp per horde member, increase by 5xp per purchase.

name: Minion: Summon Limit
description:
Increase the maximum instances of a minion you may have active at once.
This limit is per minion ability, and not a passive for your entire character.

name: Minion: Summon Troop
description: Summon a Troop enemy template, selected when you make this ability. You cannot add anything to the template.

name: Minion: Tandem Attack
description:
Requires an active Minion.
When you or a minion spend AP to make a prepared action at the same time as the other, both attacks are combined into a single attack for the purposes of overcoming Damage Resistance. 
This effect may only be triggered once per turn. Your minions may also use this effect to Tandem Attack with other minions under your control.

name: Mountable
description:
Requires Minion or Object. The minion or object now counts as a mount under mounting and mounted combat rules.
If the object is equipment, any creature with the object equipped becomes mountable.

name: Mounts: Evasive Maneuvers
description:
When attacked while riding a mount, you may use either the DC to hit you, or the DC to hit your mount, choosing which at will.
As long as your mount has made at least 1 movement action this round, increase the DC to hit both you and your mount by 1.

name: Mounts: Jousting
description: When dealing melee damage while riding a mount, add the mount's STR as bonus damage to the melee attack.

name: Mounts: Let's Ride
description: Mounting or dismounting is now a 1 AP action instead of a 3 AP action.

name: Mounts: Synergistic Attack
description:
When you make a successful attack roll while mounted, if your mount also has an attack that can strike the same target, your mount may automatically succeed and deal damage to that target and both attacks are combined for purposes of overcoming damage resistance. 
Your mount must still consume its normal AP and fulfill any normal conditions to use this effect.

name: Movement Type: Add CHAR
description: Add additional squares of movement to a movement type based on a chosen CHAR. Each movement type can only have one CHAR added to it at a time.
xpCost: 3x XP of a single square of that movement type

name: Movement Type: Charge
description: When using movement attached to this ability, the creature may only move in straight lines and must stop at any obstacle they are unable to pass over
xpCost: -10 xp from each square of movement

name: Movement Type: Guarded
description: Choose a movement type, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity with that movement

name: Movement Type: Roll based
description: Add additional squares of movement based on CHAR ability check, adding one square for each success

name: Movement: Burrowing
description: Increase burrow speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. You can only burrow through terrain (ie no HP on the thing you're burrowing through)

name: Movement: Decrease
description:
Duration effects: While the ability is in effect your movement is reduced for each move action taken
Instant effects: for 1 round, your movement is reduced for each move action taken

name: Movement: Flying
description: Increase fly speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting.

name: Movement: Gliding
description: Increase glide speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. You may move down or horizontally with this speed. While gliding you fall 5 squares per round.

name: Movement: Hover Max Height
description: The default height for hover is a couple inches from the ground (i.e. still in the same square as if standing). This extra increases the maximum height at which you can hover. When you would take falling damage, you may reduce the fallen distance by this amount.

name: Movement: Hover Speed
description: Increase hover speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. By default you only hover a couple inches above the surface.

name: Movement: Ignore Terrain Difficulty
description:
Choose a type of terrain, when trying to move or act within that type of terrain you are no longer required to make movement checks or reduce your movement speed because of environmental hazards of that terrain type.
For example, if you choose thick foliage you no longer treat it as difficult terrain and move at normal speed, and may also climb normal trees without making a climb check. 
Example terrain types: thick foliage, icy terrain, tight-ropes, narrow spaces, loose scattered debris fields, etc.
xpCost:
30 xp per terrain type
150 xp for all terrain types

name: Movement: Increase
description:
Increase movement speed by 1 square.
If you have at least 1 square of movement of a type, your character may move in that style when they take a move action.
xpCost:
Land Speed: 20 xp
Swim Speed: 20 xp
Leap: 25 xp
Hover: 25 xp
Spider Climbing: 30 xp
Burrowing: 30 xp
Gliding: 30 xp
Flying: 40 xp
Teleport: 40 xp

name: Movement: Jump
description: Increase jump distance by 1 square. This movement type does not allow Sprinting. When using Jump movement, each AP spent lets you travel up to that many squares in a straight line, horizontally, vertically or diagonally. You must land on the ground before you can jump again

name: Movement: Land Speed
description: Increase land speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting

name: Movement: Push
description:
Pushes the target of the ability in both a direction and for a distance. 
Can be applied to self, may be a discount instead in certain situations.
By default, allows pushing in any direction, but you may apply a conditional for -30xp to only push away from you.
xpCost:
10 xp per square of horizontal movement
35 xp per square of vertical or horizontal movement

name: Movement: Push Resist
description: When you would be pushed, reduce the distance by a number of squares.
xpCost:
10 xp per square of horizontal movement
35 xp per square of vertical or horizontal movement

name: Movement: Requires Movement
description: This ability may only be activated after you have used a movement action this turn.

name: Movement: Spider Climbing
description: Increase climb speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. While using this movement you can freely move on walls and ceilings as well as the ground.

name: Movement: Swim Speed
description: Increase swim speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. This does not give you the ability to breath underwater or anything

name: Movement: Teleport
description: Increase teleport speed by 1 square. This movement type does not allow Sprinting. Without extras, you cannot teleport through walls. You do count as moving from your space for reactions with that trigger. Movement debuffs do affect this movement.

name: Movement: Triggers Move
description: Using this ability allows the creature to make a movement action as part of the ability
xpCost: 20% of the cost of any additional movement per [Movement: Increase]

name: Movement: Triggers Natural Movement
description: When this ability is used trigger a move action as part of this ability's use.

name: Negatable
description: Effect can be cancelled by an enemy with a 2 AP action, ex: extinguish a fire, punch to interrupt a spell

name: Object
description:
This effect is automatically applied to objects bought with currency as a 0 xp effect. 
Converts the ability into an object with an HP of 10, DR (all) of 10 and size 0. The shape and type of object is set when this effect is purchased, and has no inherent mechanical effects without any being purchased and attached to this effect.
If the object is destroyed it can be restored for or repaired by any means reasonable for the type of object. If the object is lost or consumed and purchased with XP, it can be replaced for free by spending a long rest to replace it. 
You cannot create currency via this means.
Handedness is recommended, as most objects normally require a free hand.
xpCost:
0 xp for anything purchased with currency
-30 xp (base) for an object that has no hand requirement
-50 xp for an object that requires a free hand to operate (Handedness(1) included)
-70 xp for an object with Handedness(2)

name: Object: Contact Damage
description:
The object deals damage inherently to any creature that comes into contact with it. 
The object deals this damage at the start of each turn a creature is in contact, or immediately when new contact is made.
If the object is of a large enough size that occupies multiple squares, moving from one square into another is considered making a new contact and deals damage.
This extra can also be used as a flaw depending on circumstances. 
This is useful for electrified items, pools of lava or acid, or fields of caltrops.

name: Object: Detachable
description:
When this object would be affected by Damage, it may instead be removed from your character and moved into an adjacent square to reduce the points of damage by half, rounded down.
Any appropriate AP must be spent to collect and re-equip the object.

name: Object: Dual-wieldable
description: When the character has equipped this item in their off-hand, it is capable of using dual-wielding rules

name: Object: Durability
description: Increases the HP of a summoned object.

name: Object: Fragile
description: The object is particularly susceptible to damage of any kind. Reduce the object's HP to 5 and damage resistances all to 0.

name: Object: Hardened Structure
description:
Requires an object that is a structure or vehicle.
Adds points of Damage Resist (All) to a structure or vehicle making it harder for normal creatures and weapons to damage it.
All objects begin with DR(All) of 10.

name: Object: Heavy Equipment
description: Requires Object. Makes an object unable to be easily moved. The object may only be activated when stationary.

name: Object: Incredible Durability
description:
Requires Object.
Item cannot be destroyed by HP damage or reduced in effect by damage or Sunder effects.
However, you must choose a single damage type (besides True Damage) the object is NOT immune to.

name: Object: Indestructible
description:
Requires Object.
Item cannot be destroyed by HP damage or reduced in effect by damage or Sunder effects.
However, you must choose some way that the item may still be destroyed.

name: Object: Intangible
description: Converts an object to be intangible, allowing creatures to pass through the space it occupies regardless of its size category.

name: Object: Quick Draw
description: When this item is drawn or stowed, it may be done as a 0 AP action, instead of a 1 AP action.

name: Object: Quick Replace
description: When a non-summoned object is destroyed or lost, it can be replaced on a short rest instead of a long rest.

name: Object: Refreshable
description: Requires Limited Uses purchased with gold. Charges refresh on long rest

name: Object: Secured
description:
Requires an Object that makes sense to be vulnerable to disarment.
Item cannot be disarmed, or otherwise forcibly removed from the character without more extreme circumstances.

name: Object: Special Ammo
description:
Converts the ability into 'unit' of ammunition for a given weapon type as appropriate for that weapon (ex, a bullet for a gun, an arrow for a bow).
The ability triggers when the ammo successfully strikes a target and then is consumed. This ability uses the range of the given weapon and the AP of either the Special Ammo or the Weapon, whichever is higher.

name: Object: Structure
description:
Requires Object.
Makes the object craft more slowly (10 gold per success per day of work instead of 50), and the object may no longer be moved by any but exceptional means.

name: Object: Structure - Room Buff
description:
Requires Object: Structure.
Staying in or otherwise properly utilizing this room provides a buff to the occupant for a certain number of days.
Continuous use of the room refreshes the buff's duration.

name: Object: Summoned
description:
Converts the objects from a permanent object into a summoned object that can be conjured using AP. By default, only a single summoned object may exist at one time, or a small number of tiny/simple objects with GM permission (such as ball bearings or darts).
You can create currency via this means, but it disappears like all other objects when the effect ends.

name: Object: Summoned Quantity
description: Increases the number of summoned objects that can exist simultaneously.

name: Object: Thrown
description: When this ability is activated, the character throws the object and may not use it again without another object or retrieving it.

name: Object: Wall
description:
Requires Object: Structure.
The volumetric area the structure occupies may be rearranged into a wall shape that occupies the same volume of space.
Bring a calculator.

name: Passive: Dispellable
description:
This passive or permanent ability is now vulnerable to being dispelled by other creatures. Once dispelled, it must be re-applied as a 3 AP self-only ability.
The AP cost or refund of reapplying the passive may be adjusted, with them being adjusted to half the xp value of a normal AP cost effect.

name: Polymorph: Baleful
description:
Transform another unwilling creature into a new shape or species after a successfull attack check. The XP value of this effect equals the approximate power level of the creature chosen when this ability is purchased, with weaker creatures costing more.
For example, turning a hulking orc into a human could cost 50 xp, but turning them into a goldish on land would cost 250 xp thanks to being essentially stunned and slowly dying.
xpCost: XP cost based on creature type chosen

name: Polymorph: Willing
description:
Transform yourself or another willing creature into a new shape or species. The XP value of this effect equals the approximate power level of the creature chosen when this ability is purchased.
For example, a goldish would cost 10 xp and allow the user to swim and breathe underwater, but little else; while a dragon would be more expensive.
xpCost: XP cost based on creature type chosen

name: Prone
description: Knocks an unwilling creature prone. See Prone rules.

name: Range
description:
Increases the distance an ability can reach. Can attack at up to 2x distance, but DC is increased by 2 when beyond purchased distance.
Area of Effect abilities trigger their area when they strike a target up to this range.
xpCost:
0 - melee
5 xp per square/meter of range

name: Range: Area Effect Circle
description: Add radius to a circle shaped Area of Effect. Requires Target: Area of Effect

name: Range: Area Effect Cone
description: Add range to a cone shaped Area of Effect. Requires Target: Area of Effect
xpCost:
10xp per square of 45 degrees
15xp per square of 90 degrees

name: Range: Area Effect Height
description: Add squares of height to an Area of Effect. Requires Target: Area of Effect

name: Range: Area Effect Line
description: Add squares of distance to a Line shaped Area of Effect. Requires Target: Area of Effect

name: Range: Area Effect Sphere
