description: Add radius to a sphere shaped Area of Effect. Requires Target: Area of Effect

name: Range: Extreme Range
description:
Requires a Utility or RP Effect.
The ability has a range best measured in kilometers rather than squares. Each square of range attached to this effect is multiplied 100x.

name: Range: Linked to Weapon
description: The range of this ability becomes the range of an equipped weapon

name: Range: Melee Reach
description: Increases the reach of a melee attack by 1 square

name: Range: Minimum Range
description: The target of the attack must be at least this far away otherwise the attack automatically fails

name: Range: Others Only
description: Only applicable to Buff or Heal effects. You can no longer target yourself for these beneficial effects.

name: Range: Self Only
description: Removes all range from an ability, allowing it to only be used upon yourself

name: Range: Thrown
description: The range of this ability is equal to your throwing range as determined by your STR stat.

name: Range: Unlimited
description:
The attack will continue to travel until it impacts a target and is itself unaffected by gravity or distance. Ranged attacks made by this ability have a normal DC while within the ability's specified range, but increase the DC by 1 for each multiple of the ability's range. If the attack is a save instead of attack roll, reduce the save DC instead.
You may also apply this to AoE abilities.
Example: an attack with a range of 5 meters would be DC 3 (normal) to hit a target at from 0-5 meters, a DC 4 from 6-10 meters, and a DC 5 from 11-15 meters, etc
xpCost: Double the price of the range increment (Range becomes 10xp per square, Range: Area Effect Sphere becomes 50xp per square etc)

name: Reaction
description: When chosen, specify a condition. When that condition is met this Ability may be used outside of normal turn order by spending the Ability’s AP cost without going into negative AP.

name: Reaction only
description: Requires Reaction. Can only use this ability when reaction trigger is met, unusable at will.

name: Reaction: Extra Reactions
description: Requires a Reaction and an AP cost of 0. Allows an additional use of the 0 AP reaction for each purchase of this extra, bypassing normal once-per-round restrictions.

name: Reaction: Hyper Reactive
description: Requires reaction ability that costs 0 AP. Removes the normal 0 AP restriction to allow this reaction to be taken additional times per turn. The reaction can be used any number of times, but each consecutive use in the same turn increases the DC of the ability's check by 1.

name: Reaction: Lightning
description: Requires Reaction and Reaction: Quick. Allows going into negative AP to ensure ability activation when a reaction trigger is met. Can continously be used whenever the reaction trigger is met, even while AP is currently negative, allowing the character to go even more negative on AP.

name: Reaction: Quick
description: Requires Reaction. Allows going into negative AP to ensure ability activation when a reaction trigger is met. Cannot be used again while already below 0 AP.

name: Recklessness
description:
Increase the damage of this ability as HP drops.
Gain 1 damage die for each 10 of your max HP missing.

name: Regeneration
description:
Restore limbs, body parts, etc after they are lost in combat, accidents, and really kinky one-night-stands.
Restores the state of the body to what would be considered "normal" for the character.

name: Reloading
description: After using this ability, you must use a number of AP to reload it before it can be used again. When applied to a weapon, the weapon attack may not be used until reloaded even if it has multiple abilities attached.

name: Reloading: Magazine
description: Requires Reloading. Reloading AP cost may be deferred a number of uses by reducing discount.

name: Reloading: Partial Reload
description:
Requires Reloading:Magazine. Part of the AP cost of reloading can be spent ahead of time to restore a proportional amount of uses, rounding down to the nearest whole amount.
For example: a 4-shot magazine that costs 4 AP to reload may spend 1 AP to reload 1 shot.

name: Reloading: Unload
description: Requires Reloading:Magazine and a sub-effect under it. When this sub effect is activated remove multiple uses of the ability instead of a single one.

name: Repeatable Saves
description:
Requires Target:Save or Resistable. 
Whenever the target is negatively affected by the effect they initially failed a save against, they may attempt the save again and end the effect if they succeed.
These additional saves only may only occur once per round.

name: Requires Active Effect
description:
In order to use this ability, you must currently have the effect specified active on your character. If the effect ends by any means, so does this effect. 
When this flaw is attached to an effect, it no longer has normal rules requiring it cost at least 10 xp, and may instead be completely a flaw, bestowing negative xp to the character; however the sum of xp spent on abilities that require this effect must be equal or greater than the negative xp bestowed from that effect.

name: Requires Active Effect - Dispel
description: Requires "Requires Active Effect". The active effect is dispelled when you use this ability, even if that ability is normally dispel immune.

name: Requires Additional Success Spent
description: Create a sub-effect on this ability and attach this flaw. You must spend additional successes to activate this sub-effect, and if not the ability activates without activating those sub-effects.

name: Requires Called Shot Location
description: This effect may only trigger as part of a called shot on the location specified when this flaw is taken

name: Requires Consumable
description:
You must consume an object or a number of smaller objects specified when this flaw is taken in order to use this Ability. The player must keep track of how many of these objects they possess and they must not be an item so easily obtained and stored as to make this flaw meaningless. 
At GM discretion more expensive or difficult to obtain consumables may increase the discount offered from this flaw.

name: Requires Cover
description: The effect may not activate unless the character is currently in cover.

name: Requires Critical
description: This effect may only trigger when a critical hit has occurred

name: Requires Damage
description: This sub effect may only trigger if the base effect dealt damage

name: Requires Damage Type
description:
The attached effect can only successfully activate when the damage the overall Ability would deal is of the specified type chosen when this flaw is acquired.
This flaw is only valid on Abilities where the damage type is variable in some manner.

name: Requires Directionality
description:
The ability can only successfully activate when your position relative to the target is as indicated by this flaw.
Examples such as being above an enemy or behind them.

name: Requires Item
description: Ability needs a special focus item to use, must be more specific than generic terms like “weapon”, such as “sword” or "mage staff"
xpCost:
-30 xp
-50 xp for a specific instance of an item

name: Requires Setup
description: The ability may only be activated while setup, which is an action that requires AP. Remaining setup requires that the character or object remain stationary. If the character or object moves out of their square by any means they must use the setup action again in order to use this ability.
xpCost:
-80 xp for a setup with AP cost of 1
-15 xp each additional AP cost for setup

name: Requires Strong Foes
description: The ability can only successfully activate on creatures considered Elite or higher, otherwise it automatically fails

name: Requires Target Type
description:
If this ability is used against a target that does not meet a narrative classification chosen when this flaw is taken, then the ability can only deal a max of 1 damage and any other effects fail.
The XP refund of this flaw depends on how wide the chosen classification is, with more narrow choices refunding more XP. 
Examples: Only affects Undead, only affects stone, only affects people named Dan.
xpCost: -10 xp to -100 xp at GM approval

name: Requires Toggle
description: This ability may only be activated while toggled active, which is an action that requires AP. This lasts until the end of encounter by default, but can be ended by spending the AP again.

name: Requires Weak Foes
description: The ability can only successfully activate on creatures considered to be of Grunt or Troop rank, otherwise it automatically fails

name: Requires: Breakthrough
description: To activate this ability you must spend Breakthrough points

name: Requires: Currency
description: In order to activate this ability you must consume the required amount of currency.

name: Requires: End of Turn
description: This ability may only be used as the last ability on your turn, and may not be used as a reaction or tag-team ability.

name: Requires: ReRoll
description: To activate this ability you must spend ReRoll points

name: Requires: Start of Turn
description: This ability may only be used as the first ability on your turn, and may not be used as a reaction or tag-team ability.

name: Requires: Status
description: This ability may only affect a creature so long as it is already under the effect of the specified status effect.
xpCost:
-xp equal to the xp cost of the chosen status effect
If the status is ranked, choose how many ranks are required and use that value

name: Requires: Status - Cleanse
description: Requires "Requires: Status" flaw. When you trigger this ability, the required status is cleansed from the target. This only applies to negative status effects on enemies and positive status effects on allies (no clearing buffs from an enemy as a flaw)
xpCost: Discount equal to the Requires: Status flaw

name: ReRolls: Add
description: Increase the Character's ReRoll stat.

name: Roleplay Ability
description: An Ability to aid in roleplay scenarios
xpCost: 10-50 xp as determined by GM for usefulness

name: Roleplay: Degrades Humanity
description:
Roleplay effect with no mechanical value. Using this ability somehow degrades the "humanity" ie social ability or morality of the user in some way, shape, or form. 
The change may be temporary or permanent as the player decides.

name: Roleplay: Painful
description: Roleplay effect with no mechanical value. Using this ability causes a large amount of pain to user in a non-mechanical way, generally causing some sort of hesitation to make as much use of this ability as they otherwise could.

name: Roleplay: Pleasurable
description: Roleplay effect with no mechanical value. Using this ability causes significant pleasure in some way, shape, or form, generally encouraging the user to make use of the ability in situations where it would otherwise not be optimal or appropriate.

name: Roleplay: Room Quality
description:
Requires Object: Structure.
Increases the quality of the room/area and its decorations for roleplay purposes.
xpCost:
10 xp for basic room
30 xp for decent room
50 xp for quality room
80 xp for high quality room
100 xp for a decadent quality room

name: Saves: Boost
description: Choose a single specific save your character may make such as poison, sleep, concentration, etc and add additional dice to the pool you roll when you make that type of save.

name: Saves: Weaken
description:
Choose a single specific save your character may make such as poison, sleep, concentration, etc and remove dice from the pool you roll when you make that type of save.
You may not remove more dice from that type of save than you have in the corresponding characteristic.

name: Senses: Add
description: Adds a passive extra sense to your character. This sense is either blocked by obstacles or has a radius of 20*CUN in feet (4*CUN in squares). These senses are examples, generally enhancing an existing sense should be 20xp and gaining an entirely new sense is 50xp.
xpCost:
Nightvision: 20xp
Enhanced Scent: 20xp
Enhanced Auditory: 20xp
Enhanced Vision (Binocular): 20xp
Enhanced Vision (Microscopic): 50 xp
Enhanced Vision (X-Ray): 50 xp per square of obstruction
Echolocation: 50xp
Tremorsense: 50 xp
Thermal Vision: 20xp
Electromagnetism sense: 50 xp
Life Sense: 50 xp
Mind Sense: 50 xp
True Sight: 50 xp

name: Shouted Ability Names
description:
Your character must shout the name of an ability in order to activate it, and abilities must have names accurate to what they do. 
Gives away what you're doing, but it feels so passionate!

name: Size Category: Decrease
description:
Decreases the size category of the creature or object by one category.
This effect only affects the amount of space the target occupies and has no other mechanical effect.
Creatures of size 0 or smaller may occupy the same square as other creatures. Medium creatures are considered Size 1.

name: Size Category: Increase
description:
Increases the size category of the creature or object by one category.
This effect only affects the amount of space the creature occupies and has no other mechanical effect.
Creatures occupy space of a cube with sides equal to their size with medium creatures being Size 1.
Therefore, a Size 2 creature occupies a 2x2 square of space, and Size 3 a 3x3 square.

name: Skill Dice
description:
Effects of this ability only apply to a certain skill, not to the entire characteristic.
For example: extra dice to STR rolls, but only when running, not when lifting objects.

If the skill chosen is particularly specific (ie: flower arrangement, knitting, etc), with GM approval you may purchase skill dice for that skill at 30 xp per die without the normal increasing costs.
xpCost:
30 xp x the number of dice will have applied to this skill for each additional die.
For example, +1 die is 30xp, +2 dice is 90 xp (30 + 60), and +3 is 180 xp (30 + 60 + 90)

name: Skill Dice: Unskilled
description:
Remove dice from your dice pool when rolling a specific skill, rather than everything for a characteristic.
The skill must be one of perception, athletics, stealth, a social skill, or a class skill

name: Skill: Power Gauge
description: When you make an opposed skill check, your character knows by how much they succeeded or failed the opposed the check and how many dice the opponent rolled for the check.

name: Social: Attractive
description: Whenever your character attempts a social check with a creature who finds them within their preferences, you may reduce the DC of the check by 1

name: Social: Bonus SR
description: Increase your character's starting SR for Social Combat (see Social Combat rules)

name: Social: Disreputable
description:
When activated, this ability causes the target(s) to lose respect, or otherwise more greatly dislike your character.
This flaw is not valid on abilities that already do so, such as attacks, stealing, etc.
This flaw also renders the ability unusable on targets that are already hostile.

name: Social: Favored
description: Your character has earned the trust/love/loyalty/etc of a particular individual, group, or faction. So long as you do not abuse this favor, the specified target will aid you to the best of their ability within reason.
xpCost: variable (depending on the number and ability of the individuals)

name: Social: Forgettable
description: Your character's words or deeds are less likely to spread within the general knowledge of a populace, and are more easily forgotten

name: Social: Hated
description:
Your character has earned the hatred of a particular individual, group, or faction. Whenever this group is in any way involved they will do their utmost within their ability and character to destroy or punish you.
This flaw is not obtainable if the specified group chosen is not able to influence the story.
xpCost: variable (depending on the number and threat of the individuals)

name: Social: Heroic Bias
description: Your character's words and deeds are more likely to be taken positively by the general populace

name: Social: Infamous Bias
description: Your character's words and deeds are more likely to invoke fear and apprehension in the general populace

name: Social: Lasting Impression
description: Whenever you make a significant impression on a character, they are vastly less likely to change their opinion of you, even when presented contrary evidence

name: Social: Liked Associates
description: When your character becomes liked more by other characters, other characters in your party also become liked more by their association with you.

name: Social: Money Talks
description: Whenever your character attempts a social check and fails, they may spend 25 gold per die to reroll results

name: Social: Pendantic
description: When making social combat attack rolls, you may also add your INT dice to your normal dice pool for determining number of successes. However, usage of this effect causes other characters involved in the situation to find you generally more annoying or insufferable, lowering their opinion of you.

name: Social: Popular
description: Your character's words or deeds are more likely to spread within the general knowledge of a populace and be remembered for longer

name: Social: Public Speaking
description: Whenever you speak to a crowd your social checks affect more targets and more strongly at GM's discretion.

name: Social: Reputation
description:
Any NPC that recognizes or knows your character also knows an established fact about them, even if you haven't met before. You may lose this reputation if you repeatedly and publicly act against it.
Examples: You are a fair merchant, you will kill those that oppose you, you absolutely love cheeses

name: Social: Requires Humiliation
description: This ability may only be used on a creature that has been recently defeated in Social Combat.

name: Social: Scathing Remark
description: When succeeding a Social Combat check that insults or taunts the opponent, you may deal your CUN in additional SR but significantly lower your opponent's disposition towards you. You may only do this once per Social Combat encounter.

name: Social: Silver Tongue
description: When you succeed a Social Combat check, each bonus success reduces your opponent's SR by 2 instead of by 1.

name: Social: Stubborn
description: Reduce the amount of SR damage you take in Social Combat
xpCost: 30 xp per point of SR reduction

name: Soul Link: Full Transferral
description:
Requires Soul Link: Statuses. 
Statuses held by your partner when soul link ends are no longer automatically returned to you. This is primarily useful combined with Soul Link: Parasite

name: Soul Link: Health
description:
Choose a willing creature, for the duration of this effect you may elect to transfer up to the percentage bought of each HP damage you take to your soul-linked partner. You may choose which character's damage resist applies when the link is formed.
When a soul link is formed, choose the percent of the damage that will be redirected up to 100%.

name: Soul Link: Parasite
description:
Soul link may now be cast upon unwilling creatures as an attack roll. Any redirected damage applies as an attack allowing damage resistances to apply.
Any statuses transferred via the link may be saved against with a DC3 RES check to return them to the link origin.
xpCost: 20 xp per 10% of damage that may be transferred, maximum 90%

name: Soul Link: Requires Soul Link
description: The attached ability may only target creatures currently under the effect of a Soul Link to the user, otherwise the ability automatically fails.

name: Soul Link: Statuses
description:
Choose a willing creature, for the duration of this effect you may elect to transfer up to the number of statuses bought to your soul-linked partner, default 1. Ranked statuses are still considered 1 status regardless of their ranks for this effect.
Transferring statuses is by default a 3 AP action, any AP modification extra may be applied to it, with relevant multipliers applying to this ability in addition to any AP multipliers used for the action needed in creating the soul link.
Any statuses held by your partner when this effect ends are automatically returned to you.
xpCost: 30 xp per max status transferrable at once

name: Speed: Back In Action
description: Whenever you lose a turn due to having less than 0 AP or from being under any stun-type effects, on your next turn you generate twice your SPD in AP instead of SPD+2.

name: Speed: Energetic
description: Whenever you gain or lose AP from haste or slow effects, the amount of AP lost is decreased by 1 and the amount of AP gained is increased by 1.

name: Speed: Overhasten
description: When a haste effect would raise your AP over the maximum size of your AP pool, the additional AP is not lost and is instead retained as temporary AP points. This effect may only trigger when your AP pool is below its maximum.

name: Speed: Preparation is Key
description: Your maximum AP pool is increased from 2x your AP generation to 3x your generation rate.

name: Speed: Ready for more
description: Whenever you generate AP on your turn with 3 or more AP already in your AP pool, you generate 1 additional AP.

name: Spite: Hey Fuck You Pal
description: When your character loses a social combat, your next successful attack roll against the creature that defeated them in social combat becomes a critical hit.

name: Spite: My Death or Yours
description:
When this ability is used on a target if that target is not dead when all the effects of this ability is resolved, you are instantly reduced to negative your max HP.
This flaw effect may only be used on a single non-array ability per character.
Characters killed by this effect (not the damage attached to it) must pay 50 xp or 200 gold in order to return from death by any resurrection effects.
tags: Death, Flaw, Self, Combat, Damage, Limited

name: Spite: Nobody Wins
description:
When making an opposed skill check against another creature, if you lose the skill check you may apply a catastrophic failure to yourself in order to apply a critical failure to the creature that won the opposed check.
You may only use this effect once per game session.
tags: Dice Roll, Self, Critical, Limited Use

name: Status: Breakthrough Resistant
description:
Requires an ability that applies a status effect. If the target of this ability spends a breakthrough point in order to immediately end the effect, it costs an additional breakthrough point to remove. 
Each at the start of each round, the amount of breakthrough points required to end the effect decreases by 1 back to the normal cost of 1.

name: Stealth: Observant
description: Treat your passive perception radius as 1 square radius larger per purchase

name: Stealth: Obvious
description: This ability is loud, flashy, obnoxious, or generally super obvious. Creatures anywhere near you clearly notice this ability activating, and probably don't appreciate it.

name: Stealth: Risky Behavior
description:
Whenever this ability is activated it has a much higher than normal chance of alerting hostile creatures in the area as appropriate to the context.
Depending on the ability or the context, this ability may instead antagonize creatures that were previously not hostile into becoming hostile.

name: Stealth: Sneak Attack
description:
Allows attacking another creature with the potential for that creature not to definitively identify which creature or location caused the attack.
When a creature is hit by a sneak attack, they must make a CUN check with a DC set by the sneak attack, if they fail, they know they were targeted, by not by who.

name: Stealth: Sneaking
description: Treat the passive perception radius of other creatures as 1 square smaller per purchase.

name: Stealth: Subtle
description:
Makes the Ability harder for other creatures to notice by making it quieter, more subtle, requiring less movement, etc. 
Increases the DC of perception checks to notice your ability activating by 1, starting at 1 with the first purchase.
This extra may also obscure the true nature of an ability, increasing the DC of INT checks to ascertain its function or nature by 1.
Creatures without you inside their perception radius do not notice this action activate.

name: Sub Effect
description:
Used as an organizational effect. Extras and flaws attached to a sub effect only affect that sub effect, and do not affect any other effects, extras, or flaws attached to the parent ability. 
The cost of a sub effect is the final calculated ability cost of everything attached to the sub effect, and then applied to the parent ability as a flat xp, minimum 10. 
Please see Sub Effects rules under Abilities in the main book.
xpCost: Costs the final calculated XP value of everything on the sub effect, minimum 10

name: Sub Effect: Flaws Only
description: Same as Sub Effect, but can only have flaws and modifiers.
xpCost: Costs the final calculated XP value of everything on the sub effect, can be negative

name: Successes -1
description: Using the ability removes a success from the dice results rolled. If the number of successes becomes negative, the check becomes a critical failure.

name: Successes +1
description: Using the ability guarantees one success, can stack
xpCost: 80 xp * the number of times this extra has been purchased (the second purchase is 160 xp)
tags: Dice Roll, Buff, Passive, Self, Successes

name: Sundering
description: Causes damage dealt by this attack to ignore up to 10 points of damage resist all when attacking objects.

name: Sustained
description: You must spend AP each round to maintain this duration effect.

name: Swift Hands
description: Character may perform one minor action per turn for 0 AP instead of the normal 1 AP.

name: Target: Additional Target
description: Affect one additional target within range of you

name: Target: Adjacent AoE
description: Hit everything in melee reach. This counts as a melee attack, so it still gets the bonus damage from strength.

name: Target: Arcing Shot
description: Projectiles fired with this ability may be fired upwards in a parabolic arc or use a riccochet/bounce instead of directly towards a target allowing them to avoid other objects in their path.

name: Target: Area of Effect
description:
Affect all targets within Area Effect. Default range includes only the original target.
By default all targets within the area are hit, with the exception of the caster if the effect is centered on the caster.
When making an AoE with duration choose if it targets the ground (e.g. zone of truth) or creatures (e.g. bless).
Any targets behind cover destroyed by AoE effects take leftover damage remaining after the cover was destroyed.

name: Target: Area Rings
description: Requires Target: Area of Effect. Instead of targetting all squares within an area or cone, only target the squares at the very edge of the effect.

name: Target: Chaining
description: Affect one additional target within the ability's range of the previous target

name: Target: Endless Chaining
description: Increase the DC of abilities using this effect by 1. When an ability using this effect strikes a target successfully you may spend 1 success to have this attack chain to a new target within range, there is no inherent limit to the amount of times you may trigger this chaining effect on one attack.

name: Target: Fragile Chains
description:
Requires Target Chaining. Whenever this ability strikes a target, it must succeed a skill check in order to chain to the next target. If the check fails, the chain ends.
If this flaw is combined with Endless Chaining, it increases the success cost of each chaining by 1.

name: Target: Multi-Hit Targets
description: When this ability targets multiple targets without using AoE effects it may elect to target the same target multiple times.

name: Target: Opposed Save
description:
Coverts a standard attack roll into an opposed skill check. The ability only activates by rolling more successes than your opponent, and your successes are reduced by your opponent's.
Your opponent by default rolls the same characteristic you used for your ability check.

name: Target: Opposed Save - High Stakes
description:
Requires Damage: Opposed Save. When you fail an opposed check against an enemy, you suffer the effects of your ability instead of your target. 
Not a valid flaw if your ability has no negative or damaging effects.

name: Target: Save
description:
Converts a standard attack roll into an ability that instead goes off automatically but offers targets a save to resist it. When this effect is purchased it targets RES by default. Not compatible with the Resistible Flaws.
Saves using this effect start with a DC of 3 by default
xpCost:
50 xp per point of DC above 3
0 xp at DC 3

name: Target: Save - Alter CHAR
description: Changes the characteristic targeted by a save from its default of RES to any other characteristic

name: Target: Save - Resistable
description: Target makes a save in addition to the normal attack roll
xpCost:
0 xp for DC 4
-50xp for each DC lower

name: Target: Save - Spend Successes
description: When a target fails a save check applied by this ability, make an appropriate 3 DC skill check and apply any additional successes to the ability to spent on effects that require additional successes

name: Target: Selective
description: Effect only targets creatures that meet a criteria

name: Target: Sightless
description: This abiltiy does not require line of sight on the target, instead the creature may choose a square within their range. This effect does not provide you any knowledge of the target, if you don't know where they are you have to guess.

name: Targeting: Creatures Only
description: This ability may no longer target objects.

name: Targeting: Objects Only
description: This ability may no longer target creatures.

name: Targeting: Self-harm
description: You are no longer exempt from taking damage from your own attacks, particularly AoE attacks that target your own space.

name: Terrain: Create
description:
This ability creates terrain to fill affected area. The type of terrain created must be selected when the ability is created.
Examples:chest high walls, pillars, a throne

name: Terrain: Damaging
description:
Requires Terrain: Create or Terrain: Difficult
This ability is able to alter the terrain into a form that is harmful to pass through, such as spikes, pools of green stuff, and similar.
xpCost: 30 xp per square + value of damage dice dealt.

name: Terrain: Damaging - Avoidable
description:
Requires Terrain: Damaging
The damage from the terrain can be avoided by treating it as difficult terrain, if the terrain is already difficult the creature must also succeed a DC 3 DEX save to move safely.

name: Terrain: Destroy
description: This ability destroys squares of obstructing terrain and obstructing objects (such as walls, bookshelves, doors, etc). However, it only affects them provided their HP value is 1 or not-defined (ex: you cannot use this effect against castle walls).

name: Terrain: Difficult
description: Modify the area to cause it to be difficult terrain

name: Terrain: Temporary Alterations
description:
Requires: Terrain: Create, Terrain: Difficult, or Terrain: Destroy
Convert the ability into a duration effect that lasts 1 round by default. When the ability ends, the terrain changes are reverted automatically.

name: Tireless
description: Last twice as long without needing to make exhaustion checks when doing strenuous or long physical activity and gain 1 free success on saves vs exhaustion.

name: Triggers Attack of Opportunity
description: Using this ability triggers an attack of opportunity from any creatures that threaten your square

name: Triggers Attack of Opportunity: Left Wide Open
description: Using this ability triggers an attack of opportunity from any creatures that are aware of you and have at least one weapon attack that can reach you, any attacks that this ability provokes do not consume AP

name: Triggers Defensive Opportunity
description:
When this ability activates, it provokes a Defensive Opportunity, allowing enemies other than the target to spend 1 AP to trigger their move action to move into the targeted creature's square and substitute themselves for the target for any ability effects.
If the ability dealt damage in an area, the original target does not take the area damage for this turn, even if they remain in the area after being substituted.

name: Ultimate Spite
description:
Using this ability instantly kills the caster. The caster becomes permanently unable to be resurrected by any means. This ability may not be attached to summons. If this ability is attached to a minion and used, that minion ability is removed from the game. This effect also may not be attached to items.
This effect is not subject to the normal rule of a maximum 90% discount, and instead applies a 95% discount.

name: Unavoidable: Half Effect
description: This ability always deals some of its damage, even when it misses its target. When this ability's attack roll fails, still roll half damage / apply half ranks of a ranked status / apply half of some other effect.

name: Unreliable
description: Whenever this ability rolls a 1 on the fate die during a check, the ability fails, regardless of the number of successes rolled.

name: Use Mode: Charge Up
description:
When making an attack, if you spend a multiple of the AP required to make the attack, you may roll the check for the attack only once and combine the damage of those attacks into a single hit for purposes of overcoming damage resistances.
Because this becomes a single attack, any damage added by characteristics or +1 values is only added once.

name: Use Mode: Flurry
description: On a successful attack, each die of damage is treated as a separate successful attack, meaning damage bonuses from characteristics, enemy damage resistances, on hit effects, and damage type statuses apply once per die.

name: Use Mode: Focused Strike
description: When using this ability, if you spend a multiple of the AP required to make the attack, you may add 2 successes for each multiple of the attack's AP you consumed. If this ability is a save, instead of adding a success, you may increase the DC of the save.

name: Use Mode: Full Auto
description:
When using an ability, if you spend a multiple of the AP required to use the ability, you may roll the check for the ability only once and reduce the DC to hit by multiple of AP spent.
If the roll succeeds then the attack's damage may be applied once per each success rolled, up to the the multiple of AP spent times.

name: Use Mode: Hammer Down
description: When making an attack, if you spend a multiple of the AP required to make the attack, you make the attack multiple times as normal, but only target may only apply their damage resistance to the first attack that deals damage in that attack series. If you take another action in between attacks, this effect resets.

name: Use Mode: Lightning
description:
When using this ability, if you commit to using it multiple times in a row, you may reduce the AP cost by -1 for each consecutive use. 
If an ability costing 3 AP is used, it would cost 3 AP, then 2 AP, then 1 AP, then 0 or 1 AP.
As soon as you use 0 AP, the ability follows normal 0 AP rules and may no longer be used again that turn.

name: Use Mode: Perfected Strike
description:
When using this ability, if it is the first action you perform on your turn, you may choose to have this ability consume your entire turn. If you do so, the ability no longer requires an attack roll or save and instead guarantees a successful strike against the target. This attack is automatically a called shot if applicable and any appropriate hit location may be selected for free.
This Use Mode cannot selected on an ability that consumes enough AP that you could not use it more than once a turn anyway. For example if you generate 7 AP a turn and the ability costs 6 AP, this cannot be selected.

name: Use Mode: Prepared
description:
When using this ability, it creates some effect in the world that waits to activate when a specified condition occurs. Differs from reaction in that you spend the AP up front, and don't need to act when it triggers. The ability triggers automatically even without your character's knowledge so long as the trigger is met.
If it doesn't become triggered, the effect dispels at the end of the current encounter if it is not an object or has an extended duration. You may only have up to your number of prepared instances active in this state at one time, default 1.
Very useful for traps and ambushes.

name: Use Mode: Prepared - Additional Instances
description: Allows an increased number of prepared abilities to be manifested simultaneously, increased from the default of 1.

name: Use Mode: Spray
description: When using this ability you may spend 2 additional successes to inflict an additional hit on any target within a 45 degree cone centered on your original target, or 1 additional success to inflict half damage. You may strike targets within this cone more than once. Targets that would have a higher difficulty to hit than your original target require the increased number of successes for the first hit against them.

name: Utility ability
description:
An ability that does a useful non-combat effect, This is a general-use base for any utility effects not specified elsewhere.
The cost of the utility effect is proportional to the power of the effect.
xpCost:
10-100 XP depending on the usefulness of the ability
10 - useful but very niche, or not particularly strong effects (Ex: Light Source)
30 - low power but wide use effects, or niche but decent
50 - abilities either with good power or wide applications
100 - very useful abilities, abilities that can be used in almost any situation

name: Utility: Alter Appearance
description:
Alter the appearance of an object or creature within range up to this ability's range and Size Limit (see: Utility: Increase Size Limit). 
This effect only encompasses cosmetic, non-mechanical alterations. 
If the target is unwilling, you must make a successful attack check to apply the alteration.

name: Utility: AP Transfer
description: Target an ally within range of this ability and transfer any number of your own AP to the target. You may not go below 0 AP from this effect.

name: Utility: AP Transfer - Overdraw
description: Requres Utility: AP Transfer. When you transfer AP to an ally, you may now go into negative AP, up to a maximum of negative your AP generation rate.

name: Utility: AP Transfer - Overhaste
description: Requires Utility: AP Transfer. When you transfer AP to an ally, you may transfer them more AP than their normal maximum. The extra AP remains as temporary AP until the end of their next turn.

name: Utility: Compel Truth
description:
Applies the Compel Truth status effect to a target creature, making an attack roll if the target is unwilling. While under this effect, the creature must make a DC3 RES test in order to make a deception skill check. 
Unlike most status effects, extras and flaws may also be applied to the Compel Truth status via this ability.

name: Utility: Disguise
description:
Your character temporarily takes on an alternate appearance via some means such as shapeshifting, illusion, or mundane disguise.
If you also have appearances obtained via Absorb Apperance, you may disguise yourself as an exact replica of that absorbed appearance, otherwise you may disguise yourself as generic non-specific individuals.

name: Utility: Illusion - Audio Only
description:
Requires Utility: Illusion. Not compatible with Utility: Illusion - Auditory. 
Your illusions replace their visual-only effect for an audio-only effect.

name: Utility: Illusion - Auditory
description: Requires Utility: Illusion. Your illusions may now include an auditory component.

name: Utility: Illusion - Mental
description:
Create an illusory effect of a size up to this ability's Size Limit (see: Utility: Increase Size Limit) at a square within this ability's range.  
These illusions by default are visual-only and may be either static or play a looping 'animation' and are only percieved by creatures targeted by this ability. It may depict any number of objects/creatures so long as they fit within the size limit of the ability.
Creatures who percieve the illusions recognize them as such unless this effect also has the Stealth: Subtle quality attached.

name: Utility: Illusion - Projected
description:
Create an illusory effect of a size up to this ability's Size Limit (see: Utility: Increase Size Limit) at a square within this ability's range.  
These illusions by default are visual-only and may be either static or play a looping 'animation' and are projected into the world and may be percieved by any creature with the appropriate senses. It may depict any number of objects/creatures so long as they fit within the size limit of the ability.
Creatures who percieve the illusions recognize them as such unless this effect also has the Stealth: Subtle quality attached.

name: Utility: Illusion - Reactive
description:
Requires Utility: Illusion. You may now use 1 AP to take the "Control Illusions" action. This is a concentration effect that while active you may have your illusions move and react according to your will, though they may not change entirely without recasting them.
Example: you may puppet a the illusion of a human to 'react' to another creature or keep an illusion in place over yourself as you move.

name: Utility: Illusion - Sensory
description: Requires Utility: Illusion. Your illusions may also now appear to creatures that perceive their surroundings through means other than normal vision, such as thermal or electromagnetic.

name: Utility: Illusion - Solid
description: Requires Utility: Illusion. Your illusions now feel solid under casual inspection, though forceful attempts (such as attacks) will still pass through.

name: Utility: Increase Size Limit
description:
Increase the size category of objects and creatures you may affect with this ability when dealing with the amount of mass your ability interacts with.
For example, how big an object you can lift with telekinesis, how much water you turn into acid, etc.
By default, you may only affect size 0 objects and creatures.

name: Utility: Slow Fall
description:
Applies a buff effect that reduces the speed at which the target creature falls via gravity from 50 squares a round to a nice safe 10 squares a round.
When the creature contacts the ground under this effect they do not recieve falling damage so long as they were at least 2 squares above the ground when the effect was applied.

name: Utility: Sticky
description:
This ability is 'sticky' in whatever way makes sense for the context of this ability. 
This can be used for things like sticky grenades, a flaming arrow that sticks into walls, covering yourself in tar and hugging an enemy, etc.

name: Utility: Telekinesis
description:
Manipulate an object or creature at a distance up to this ability's range and Size Limit (see: Utility: Increase Size Limit). 
If the target is unwilling, you must make a successful attack check to manipulate them.

name: Utility: Telepathy
description: Apply a buff to an ally that allows mental communication with them while they remain in range.

name: Utility: Telepathy - Hostile
description: Allows telepathy to make an attack roll to force a telepathic connection with an unwilling creature

name: Utility: Teleport
description: Teleport an object or creature within range of this ability to another point within range of this ability. If the target is unwilling, you must make a successful attack check to teleport them.

name: Utility: Teleport - Fixed Destination
description:
Requires Utility: Teleport. Objects and Creatures affected by your teleport must be sent to a fixed location, instead of any location within range. 
Examples: objects teleport to your hand, creatures teleport to a square adjacent to you.

name: Utility: Teleport - Tethered
description: Requires Utility: teleport. You may designate one target object in your possession or destination when this effect is purchased. You may teleport this object to you or teleport a target to this destination within the range of this ability with all range multiplied by 10.

name: Wealth: Disciple
description:
This effect can only be purchased using XP.
After purchasing this passive any training undergone by this character using currency has a percentage discount to the amount of currency required to receive the training. Reducing the cost from the default of 200% down to a minimum of 100%.
xpCost:
50 xp per 20% discount
Increases in cost by 50 xp each time it is purchased
Cannot lower cost below 100%.

name: Wealth: Haggler
description: Whenever your character attempts to buy an item for gold from an NPC, they gain an additional percentage discount of the item's sale value.
xpCost:
50 xp per 5% purchase discount.
Maximum 50% off regular shop items or reducing the merchant upcharge by 50%

name: Wealth: Increase Value
description: Make a skill check against a non-living target, if successful increase its monetary value. This effect can only be performed once per target. Multiple characters may use this ability on the same target only if they each use a different characteristic to make the check.

name: Wealth: Investment Purchase
description:
Must be purchased as an item.
Once per month make a LCK+(INT or CUN) roll and subtract 5, then multiply the result by the gold value purchased for your change in wealth.
World events may alter the DC or value.

name: Wealth: Investments
description: Your character due to sound investments, a trust fund, patent or some other form of passive income makes gold each day. You generate 5 gold a day with this effect. It may be purchased multiple times.
xpCost: 100 xp per 5 gold of income per day.

name: Wealth: Merchant
description: Whenever your character attempts to sell an item for gold to an NPC, they gain an additional percentage of the item's sale value in bonus gold.
xpCost:
50 xp per 5% bonus gold value.
Maximum 100% sale value.

name: Wealth: Money is Power
description: When using this ability you may add damage dice to a single instance of this ability by spending gold equal to the XP value of the damage dice added

name: Weight: Denser
description: Your character is heavier than an average creature of their size, including with it everything that would be expected as a result.
xpCost:
30 xp - heavy
50 xp - very heavy
80 xp - Extremely heavy

name: Weight: Lighter
description: Your character is lighter than an average creature of their size, including with it everything that would be expected as a result.
xpCost:
30 xp - light
50 xp - very light
80 xp - Extremely light
